column4: Package core evidence on benthic and habitat impacts and scale/recurrence risk; formatted for Port/USACE briefing use.

column3: Mobile District meeting to hear/rebut responses
column4: Meet Mobile District, capture rebuttals, and convey additional information with the consensus packet.

column3: Stakeholder convening with Port (plus delegation invite)
column4: Convene Port + scientific/fishing/property owner/NGO stakeholders to demonstrate consensus and discuss path forward.
Prepare a conditional pause pathway tied to the convening and good-faith process steps, consistent with legal strategy.
Launch the working group with participation standards and procedures for authenticating recommendations.
Create a short, decision-ready funding memo outlining offshore/upland and beneficial use funding needs and targets.
Publish landing page and run first coordinated push (action alert + media + socials) tied to the engagement process.

column3: Policy pathway decision checkpoint (WRDA vs state)
column4: Decide primary policy vehicle timing and draft the next-step plan aligned with cost-share and disposal prohibition goals.
